answers.answer: It is unusual but not impossible for your myopia to have increased. If there is no obvious cause in your eyes like cataracts, make sure you do not have diabetes. This can cause rapid increases in myopia. Could your eye be opening slightly at night? Try some sterile eye ointment in your eye at bedtime.

question: Hello, I am a 25 year old male born with Con. glaucoma and nystagmus.  The glaucoma has been very well controlled, I have a mini shunt in my left eye and have thus far had no problems with pressure in my right eye.  I lost a little bit of vision in my left eye due to the pressure being at 47 but has since over a year ago been at 9-12, my right eye has historically been at 14-16.SInce about June, I started having trouble with both of my eyes feeling very irritated.  My Rx changed from -3.75 OD & 3.50 OS in 2004/2005 to -4.50 OD & -5 OS in 2008 (Is that a big change for that time frame?).  Anyways, I have been noticing that during the night I wake up and my right eye only feels dry and irritated, but the left is fine.  I've been examined over and over by my Opth, and even sought a 2nd opinion just to be sure, and niether could find any reason for my changing vision.  Any thoughts?  Thank you very much!
title: Need some guidance
